content.p: Renumbered 1/1/2026 59-2-1204. Renter's and homeowner's credits authorized -- No interest allowed. (1) If a claimant who owns a residence files an application for a homeowner's credit under Section 59-2-1206 and meets the requirements of this part, the claimant's property tax liability for the calendar year is equal to property taxes accrued. (2) (a) A claimant meeting the requirements of this part may claim in any year either a renter's credit under Section 59-2-1209 , a homeowner's credit as provided under Section 59-2-1208 , or both. (b) If a claimant who owns a residence claims a credit under Subsection (2)(a) , the credit shall be applied against the claimant's property taxes accrued. (3) Interest is not allowed on any payment made to a renter's or homeowner's credit claimant under this part. Amended by Chapter 309 , 1998 General Session

If a claimant who owns a residence files an application for a homeowner's credit under Section and meets the requirements of this part, the claimant's property tax liability for the calendar year is equal to property taxes accrued.
A claimant meeting the requirements of this part may claim in any year either a renter's credit under Section , a homeowner's credit as provided under Section , or both.
If a claimant who owns a residence claims a credit under Subsection , the credit shall be applied against the claimant's property taxes accrued.
Interest is not allowed on any payment made to a renter's or homeowner's credit claimant under this part.
